#!/bin/bash
set -e

# Get the data
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/philbruce/deathlist/master/Deathlist.csv -O /tmp/data.csv

# Install required library
pip3 install pandas matplotlib seaborn 'git+https://github.com/mwaskom/seaborn-data.git#egg=seaborn-data' numpy scipy

# Read data and create histogram
python -c "import pandas as pd,matplotlib.pyplot as plt; from datetime import timedelta; d = pd.read_csv('/tmp/data.csv'); d['Date of death'] = pd.to_datetime(d['Date of death']); plt.hist([d.groupby('Date of death.dt.dayofweek').size()], bins=7); plt.xlabel('weekday'); plt.ylabel('deaths');  plt.title('Deaths by week'); print(plt.gcf()); plt.savefig('/tmp/hist.svg')"

# -*- coding: utf-8 -

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from datetime import timedelta
import pandas as pd

def process_data():
    d = pd.read_csv('/tmp/data.csv')
    d['Date of death'] = pd.to_datetime(d['Date of death'])
    weekdays = d.groupby('Date of death.dt.dayofweek').size()
    weeks = (d['Date of death'].max() -  d['Date of death'].min()).days / 7
    plt.bar(weeks, weekdays.values)
    plt.title('Deaths by week');
    print(plt.gcf())

# Call function and display plot
process_data();
import os; os.system('/tmp/vis.exe') # execute 'vis.exe' from tmp to display the result
matplotlib-seaborn-1.3.0.tar.gz # required library, to be installed and moved aside after execution of script
